00001 program main_grid_avg
00002 
00003   use types
00004   use gavg
00005 
00006   implicit none
00007 
00008   character (len=256) :: sControlFile, sFilePrefix, sBuf
00009   integer (kind=T_INT) :: iNumArgs, iStartYear, iEndYear
00010   character (len=256) :: sCalcBasis
00011 
00012   ! warning - calling a Fortran 2003 extension function here
00013   iNumArgs = COMMAND_ARGUMENT_COUNT()
00014 
00015   if(iNumArgs /=4 .and. iNumArgs /=5) then
00016 
00017     write(*,*)
00018     write(*,*) 'This utility simply reads the ASCII grids for a given'
00019     write(*,*) 'variable and range of years.  The output is the mean'
00020     write(*,*) 'value of the variable over the input range of years.'
00021     write(*,*)
00022     write(*,*) 'The code expects to find the output ASCII grids in the'
00023     write(*,*) 'output/annual subdirectory.  The code expects filenames'
00024     write(*,*) 'to be named with the following pattern:'
00025     write(*,*)
00026     write(*,*) 'FilePrefix_Year.FileSuffix'
00027     write(*,*)
00028     write(*,*) 'Ex.: RECHARGE_1967.asc'
00029     write(*,*)
00030   endif
00031 
00032   call Assert(LOGICAL(iNumArgs==4 .or. iNumArgs==5,kind=T_LOGICAL), 
00033     "Usage: grid_average [control file name] " 
00034     //"[file prefix] [start year] [end year] [ANNUAL | MONTHLY | SEASONAL]")
00035 
00036   ! warning - calling a Fortran 2003 extension function here
00037   call GET_COMMAND_ARGUMENT(1,sControlFile)
00038   call GET_COMMAND_ARGUMENT(2,sFilePrefix)
00039   call GET_COMMAND_ARGUMENT(3,sBuf)
00040   read(sBuf,FMT=*) iStartYear
00041 
00042   call GET_COMMAND_ARGUMENT(4,sBuf)
00043   read(sBuf,FMT=*) iEndYear
00044 
00045   if(iNumArgs==5) then
00046     call GET_COMMAND_ARGUMENT(5,sBuf)
00047     read(sBuf,FMT=*) sCalcBasis
00048   end if
00049 
00050   ! Now, let's fire this baby up!
00051   call gavg_init(sControlFile, sFilePrefix, iStartYear, iEndYear, &
00052     TRIM(sCalcBasis))
00053 
00054   stop
00055 
00056 end program main_grid_avg
